text.value: Can you make i insert NBT by string on _setstack ?
JsonToNBT does not exist see my code you are implemented to Intellik

here what i want to insert : {Damage:0,Enchantments:{id:\"minecraft:sharpness\",lvl:3s},{id:\"minecraft:unbreaking\",lvl:3s},display:{Lore:'{\"italic\":false,\"text\":\"Lore text\"}','{\"italic\":false,\"text\":\"Lore text 2\"}'}}
already try with "tag" and not work too

@...\base\procedures\TestCmdProcedure.java
I already try with "tag" but that not work

Okay, thanks for clarifying that you tried using "tag" as the key and it still didn't work.
A few things to try:
- Make sure the NBT string is valid JSON. You can validate it using an online JSON validator.
- Try simplifying the NBT to just set a display name first:
``` String nbtString = "{display:{Name:'{\"text\":\"My Item\"}'}}" ```
- Print out the ItemStack after setting the NBT to see if it changed at all.
- Use a debugger or logging to check that the NBT is set on the ItemStack before giving it to the player.
- Double check that the mod version, Forge version, and any mappings are up to date.
My suspicion is there may be something small wrong with the formatting of the JSON NBT string that is causing it to not get applied properly. Simplifying the NBT and validating the JSON format would be good first steps.
Let me know if you make any progress or need any other suggestions! Happy to help troubleshoot further.
yes its what the game output from another item
yes its what the game output from another item
